Card Text: If you're here, there's been an error.
Left hover text: Close the game and bugfix genius

Card Text: Filler start card
As you head into the office for your second day, you're greeted by a familiar face.
I see you've survived day 1. Keep it up Chosen One
I've left today's files on your desk. Hop to it.
An anonymous complaint is submitted about “the person running this joint” (the player). They complain about transparency, no workers considered at the top level, and poor benefits.
Left hover text: Too bad. They knew what they were getting into. Find this person and terminate them.
Right hover text: Maybe they have a point, actually. Is there a way we can do better for them?

Card Text: After the complainer's death, fewer rank-and-file employees are willing to come forward about their complaints, so there’s more order in the trenches.
After the complaints were addressed, more employees feel safe approaching you about their concerns.

Basil, the head of Zealotry Innovations, barks at you from your office door. He leads you to the shared executive kitchen. Basil jumps on the counter and frantically scratches at the cabinet doors. You open it to see nothing unusual - just the same pack of pancake mix and dry creamer that’s there every day.
Left hover text: I don’t see what the problem is. Tell Basil you’ll look into it later.
Right hover text: Keep looking. Basil’s a good boy with good instincts.

Card Text: Basil whines as he leaves the kitchen. You see that everyone in the shared executive kitchen is looking at you with disappointment for upsetting the good boy.
Basil was on to something - you find a stash of gold way in the back. How long has that been there? In any case, you spend a little of it on a pizza party for the company.

Your applicant filing program has suddenly started asking you questions through strange pop ups in the lower corner. It’s asking about the value of human life and how it should feel about possibly altering someone’s destiny for the worst by letting them be found by this corporation.
Left hover text: Answer honestly. It’s probably good to have open conversations about the impact of your work.
Right hover text: Call IT to smooth this bug out right away. I can’t waste time with this when I have actual work to do.

Card Text: The software is thankful that you are treating it with dignity and respect, unlike your predecessors. As a thanks, it alerts you to a major weakness in a rival corporation’s firewall.
IT asks you to turn the computer off and then back on. They tell you to contact them again if the issue persists. The ticket is then closed.
Hey Chosen One - The two interview candidates are here. I'll send the first one in.
Hey, I'm Viola. I'm ready to get this interview started!
What should I ask Viola about her work history?
Left hover text: What was the most important lesson you learned form the girl scouts?
Right hover text: When did you start working with the Shadow League?

Card Text: I've never been a scout, but I like writing fanfiction about them.
I joined the Shadow League Assassins when I was 17 - the youngest person to ever join!
What should I ask Viola about her skills?
Left hover text: How do you feel about leadership?
Right hover text: Would you say that you're a creative person?

Card Text: “I take my role as a leader seriously. I like shaping young minds. The children are our future, and I am worried they’ll miss out on the art of subtle evisceration.”
“A combination of ingenuity and practical telekinesis led to the Ironing Board Blood Eagle that won me Most Creative Kill from the Shadow League Assassins.”
What should I ask Viola about her motive?
Left hover text: Why do you want to join this organization?
Right hover text: Do you remain calm in stressful situations?

Card Text: “I think this would be a great opportunity for me. I really want to prove that I’m not just my accomplishments - I’m better!”
“I wouldn’t say I’m at risk of losing control. When I feel stressed, I repeat my mantra: I am not my murders.”
It's time to meet the second candidate, Benny Placeholder.
Benny here.
What should I ask Benny about his work history?
Left hover text: “What is your greatest accomplishment as a Barista?”
Right hover text: “What are you most proud of as the former director of MK Ultra 2?”

Card Text: “I won Barista of Quarter 2 ‘23 by my own merits, and definitely not by sabotage.”
“I invented a drug-induced interrogation technique called the Super Spoon Noodle.”
What should I ask Benny about his skills?
Left hover text: “What is the best way to improve morale?”
Right hover text: “How do you think you can improve this organization?”

Card Text: “You have to get to know the people you work with. You wouldn’t give a dark, hearty Sumatra blend to someone who just drinks coffee once a day!”
“So I learned as MK Ultra 2 director that I’m not very good at chemistry, but I did learn that I was very good at stealing cleaning chemicals from my Barista job.”
What should I ask Benny about his motive?
Left hover text: “Where do you see yourself in five years?”
Right hover text: “How will you know when you have succeeded in this role?”

Card Text: “Honestly I’m fine where I’m at. I don’t see the need to improve my station if I’m happy where I am.”
“Mom always said I wouldn’t amount to anything, and I really want to rub that in her face. She’s dead, but I still wanna do it.
Who would you like to hire?
Well done Chosen One, that'll be all for today. Head home and get some sleep.
You head home and crash on your bed. Before long, you fall fast asleep.
